column4: hi, is there a default shortcut to make the font size in your terminal smaller?
i'm using the default ubuntu terminal
for the oen in Applications->Accessories you can just go to Edit -> Current Profile and change it from there
or right click on the terminal and select Edit Current Profile
ah i see.  is there a keyboard shortcut though?
i want to be able to change it on the fly, and i think i stumbled across the shortcut somehow but cant remember what i did
but you could create multiple profiles with different font sizes
hmm i see.  so there's no keyboard shortcut to do it temporarily?
I don't recall ever running into that
closest I can think of is creating a shortcut that opens a terminal with a particular profile
but nothing like ctrl++ or ctrl+- in a browser
